xyz.fsgek.common.base

Class GekString

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.fsgek.common.base.GekString

  • public class GekString
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for String/CharSequence.

      static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object... objs)
      Returns deep-array-to-string for given objects.
      static java.lang.String toString(@Nullable java.lang.Object obj)
      Returns a string follows: returns String.valueOf for given object if it is not an array; if given object is primitive array, returns Arrays.toString for it; if given object is Object[], returns Arrays.deepToString for it; else returns String.valueOf for given object This method is same as: toString(obj, true, true)
      static java.lang.String toStringWith(@Nullable java.lang.Object obj, boolean arrayCheck, boolean deepToString)
      Returns a string follows: if given object is primitive array and array-check is true, returns Arrays.toString for it; if given object is Object[] and both array-check and deep-to-string are true, returns Arrays.deepToString for it; if given object is Object[] and array-check is true and deep-to-string is false, returns Arrays.toString for it; else returns String.valueOf for given object
      static java.lang.String uncapitalize(java.lang.CharSequence chars)
      Uncapitalizes given chars, equivalent to firstCase(chars, false).
      static java.lang.String upperCase(java.lang.CharSequence chars)
      Returns a String of which content is upper case of given chars.

      • split

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.CharSequence> split(java.lang.CharSequence chars,
                                                           java.lang.CharSequence separator)
        Splits given chars by given separator, using subView(CharSequence, int, int) to generate sub CharSequence. If chars or separator is empty, or separator's length is greater than chars' length, or separator is never matched, return an empty list.

        Note empty part will be created there is no char between separator and the next separator, position of start or end. That means, if the returned list is not empty, its length is at least 2.

        Parameters:
        chars - given chars
        separator - given separator
        Returns:
        split list

      • split

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.CharSequence> split(java.lang.CharSequence chars,
                                                           java.lang.CharSequence separator,
                                                           GekString.CharsGen generator)
        Splits given chars by given separator, using given sub-sequence generator to generate sub CharSequence. If chars or separator is empty, or separator's length is greater than chars' length, or separator is never matched, return an empty list.

        Note empty part will be created there is no char between separator and the next separator, position of start or end. That means, if the returned list is not empty, its length is at least 2.

        Parameters:
        chars - given chars
        separator - given separator
        generator - given sub-sequence generator
        Returns:
        split list

      • replace

        public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.CharSequence chars,
                                       java.lang.CharSequence matcher,
                                       java.lang.CharSequence replacement)
        Replaces all given matcher in given chars with given replacement.
        Parameters:
        chars - given chars
        matcher - given matcher (to replace)
        replacement - given replacement
        Returns:
        replaced string

      • replace

        public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.CharSequence chars,
                                       java.lang.CharSequence matcher,
                                       java.lang.CharSequence replacement,
                                       int limit)
        Replaces given matcher in given chars with given replacement. If given limit < 0, replace all; if given limit = 0, do nothing and return given chars to string; If given limit > 0, this method will replace given limit times.

        FOr example, replaceFirst is equivalent to 

             replace(chars, matcher, replacement, 1);
        Parameters:
        chars - given chars
        matcher - given matcher (to replace)
        replacement - given replacement
        limit - given limit
        Returns:
        replaced string

        the index

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(@Nullable
                                        @Nullable java.lang.Object obj)
        Returns a string follows:
        • returns String.valueOf for given object if it is not an array;
        • if given object is primitive array, returns Arrays.toString for it;
        • if given object is Object[], returns Arrays.deepToString for it;
        • else returns String.valueOf for given object
        This method is same as: toString(obj, true, true)
        Parameters:
        obj - given object
        Returns:
        computed string

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object... objs)
        Returns deep-array-to-string for given objects.
        Parameters:
        objs - given objects
        Returns:
        computed string

      • toStringWith

        public static java.lang.String toStringWith(@Nullable
                                            @Nullable java.lang.Object obj,
                                            boolean arrayCheck,
                                            boolean deepToString)
        Returns a string follows:
        • if given object is primitive array and array-check is true, returns Arrays.toString for it;
        • if given object is Object[] and both array-check and deep-to-string are true, returns Arrays.deepToString for it;
        • if given object is Object[] and array-check is true and deep-to-string is false, returns Arrays.toString for it;
        • else returns String.valueOf for given object
        Parameters:
        obj - given object
        arrayCheck - the array-check
        deepToString - whether deep-to-string
        Returns:
        computed string

      • startWith

        public static java.lang.String startWith(java.lang.CharSequence src,
                                         java.lang.CharSequence start)
        Returns a string starts with given start string. If given source string starts with given start string, return itself; if not, return start + src.
        Parameters:
        src - given source string
        start - given start string
        Returns:
        a string starts with given start string

      • removeStart

        public static java.lang.String removeStart(java.lang.CharSequence src,
                                           java.lang.CharSequence start)
        Returns a string doesn't start with given start string. If given source string starts with given start string, remove the start chars and return; else return source string.
        Parameters:
        src - given source string
        start - given start string
        Returns:
        removed string

        Parameters:

        end - given end string
        Returns:
        a string ends with given end string

      • toLong

        public static long toLong(@Nullable
                          @Nullable java.lang.CharSequence chars)
        Converts given chars to long, if given chars is blank or failed to convert, return 0.
        Parameters:
        chars - given chars
        Returns:
        long from chars

      • lazyString

        public static java.lang.CharSequence lazyString(java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.String> supplier)
        Returns an object which is lazy for executing method Object.toString(), the executing was provided by given supplier.

        Note returned CharSequence's other methods (such as CharSequence.length()) were based on its lazy toString().

        Parameters:
        supplier - given supplier
        Returns:
        lazy char sequence

      • subView

        public static java.lang.CharSequence subView(java.lang.CharSequence chars,
                                             int start)
        Returns a sub-range view of given chars from given start index inclusive to end. The two chars will share the same data so any operation will reflect each other.

        Note the method CharSequence.subSequence(int, int) of returned CharSequence will still use subView(CharSequence, int, int).

        Parameters:
        chars - given chars
        start - given start index inclusive
        Returns:
        sub-range view of given chars

      • subView

        public static java.lang.CharSequence subView(java.lang.CharSequence chars,
                                             int start,
                                             int end)
        Returns a sub-range view of given chars from given start index inclusive to given end index exclusive. The two chars will share the same data so any operation will reflect each other.

        Note the method CharSequence.subSequence(int, int) of returned CharSequence will still use this method.

        Parameters:
        chars - given chars
        start - given start index inclusive
        end - given end index exclusive
        Returns:
        sub-range view of given chars
